availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Terrill (Madison County, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William T. Terrill and Perthina Terrill. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Lawyer in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private from February 1863 to December 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 1, p. 221A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 150.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 35.
